description: Replaces the schematic match-adapt layout algorithm with a new approach based on BPC (Box-Pin-Connection) graphs, enabling more robust and flexible schematic auto-layout for groups using a corpus of graph templates and adaptation logic. Updates dependencies and test fixtures to support the new algorithm.

title: fix: subcircuit having multiple traces between same pins
description: Fixes autorouter bug where subcircuits could generate multiple traces between the same pins, causing redundant routing and potential errors. Now, only unrouted traces are considered for autorouting within subcircuits, preventing duplicate connections.
body: `getSimpleRouteJsonFromCircuitJson` collects all the `source_trace` elements whose `subcircuit_id` is this group OR any descendant sub-circuit (even when that subcircuit is having traces which is already routed). And then that simpleRouteJson is passed to the autorouter where the already resolved `source_trace` gets dragged.

title: fix net ids on schematic net labels
description: Fixes incorrect assignment of source_net_id on schematic net labels to ensure they reference the correct net object rather than just the net name.

title: Automatic net label orientation based on connectsTo
description: Net labels in schematics now automatically orient themselves based on the position of the connected port, improving label placement and readability.

title: check for gh user name instead of account id for settings dialog, to make sure it is shown  locally
description: Fixes bug where package settings dialog would not show for package owners if their GitHub account ID did not match the stored creator_account_id, by switching to username-based ownership check.

title: feat: Restrict AI review generation to package owners
description: Restricts the ability to generate or re-generate AI reviews to only the package owner, preventing other authenticated users from accessing this functionality.
body:
This pull request introduces a security enhancement that limits the ability to generate or re-generate AI reviews to only the package owner. Previously, any authenticated user had access to this functionality.

---

### 🔒 Changes Implemented

#### `src/components/ViewPackagePage/components/important-files-view.tsx`

* Added a `packageAuthorId` prop to the component.
* Replaced the `useUser` hook with `useGlobalStore` to retrieve the currently logged-in user's session info.
* Conditionally render the **"Request AI Review"** and **"Re-request AI Review"** buttons only when the logged-in user's `github_username` matches the `packageAuthorId`.

#### `src/components/ViewPackagePage/components/repo-page-content.tsx`

* Passed the `packageAuthorOwner` (sourced from `packageInfo.owner_github_username`) as a prop to the `ImportantFilesView` component.

title: Fix caching issue by rounding the deltas with a higher precision
description: Fixes a subtle but important bug in the autorouter's caching logic by rounding delta values to higher precision, preventing cache misses due to floating-point rounding errors in the unravelMultiSectionSolver.
body:
### Why are we changing this?
We've observed cases where the `unravelMultiSectionSolver` was not completely caches during the second time it was solved. The working theory was that there were some rounding issues causing this.

### What has changed?
Delta values used in in the cached values of the `unravelMultiSectionSolver` are now rounded to a higher precision than the coordinates. This prevents issues from accumulated errors due to rounding.

### Visualisation
https://streamable.com/yr0hm1

title: fix: search by the value and SI unit, not the absolute value

description: Fixes a bug where findPart would throw an error if the 'fuses' array is undefined, ensuring robust handling of missing part data.

title: Get BPC Graph Distance Example
description: Adds example tests and documentation for computing Weisfeiler-Leman (WL) distance between BPC graphs, and introduces a utility to visualize flat BPC graph representations.

title: Merging Example
description: Adds a usage example and visual snapshot for mergeBoxSideSubgraphs in the README and test suite, demonstrating how to merge two subgraphs and the resulting output.

title: Fix Floating Box Assignment and generate README image
description: Fixes incorrect assignment of positions to floating boxes in BPC graphs and adds a visual example to the README, ensuring floating boxes are placed based on network connections rather than defaulting to origin or averaging, and documents the behavior with a new test and image.

title: Implementation for net adaption and floating box assignment
description: Adds new algorithms and utilities for adapting a source BPC graph to match the netlist and structure of a target BPC graph, including assignment of floating box positions and edit operations for adjacency matrices. Removes the previous GraphNetworkTransformer and related operation-based transformation system, replacing it with a matrix-edit-based approach. Includes comprehensive new tests for assignment, matrix editing, and net adaptation.

title: Add @tscircuit/cli downstream dependency
description: Adds @tscircuit/cli as a dependency, categorizes it as 'Downstream', updates the dependency graph, and adds a test to ensure correct categorization.
body:
## Summary
- track `@tscircuit/cli` in dependency graph
- categorize `@tscircuit/cli` as `Downstream`
- test that new package is recognized as downstream
- install `@tscircuit/cli`

## Testing
- `bun test tests`
- `bun run format` *(fails: Script not found)*

------

title: Refactor internal layout
description: Refactors the internal structure of the calculate-cell-boundaries library by moving algorithm code out of the claude folder, modularizing core logic into separate files, and updating imports, without changing user-facing functionality.
body:
## Summary
- move algorithm internals out of `claude` folder
- rename `types.ts` used inside the algorithm to `internalTypes.ts`
- update imports across the library
- rename example component to `cell-boundaries.tsx`

## Testing
- `bun test tests`

------
